intro: Bituminaria morisiana, commonly known as the Morisian bituminous plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Bituminaria morisiana is often found in open habitats such as shrublands and grasslands.
